sentence.Network_en: You will be surprised there is so much infelicity in the world.
sentence.Network_cn: 你会感到惊讶世界上竟有这么多不幸的事情.

sentence.Network_en: A judgmental infelicity plagued past generations.
sentence.Network_cn: 这种不恰当的看法曾困扰了几代人.

sentence.Network_en: There is so much infelicity in the world.
sentence.Network_cn: 人世间有很多不幸的事.

list.abs: 的相关例句  1. You will be surprised there is so much infelicity in the world. 你会感到惊讶世界上竟有这么多不幸的事情. 来自《现代英汉综合大词典》.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'unhappiness'): from Latin infelicitas, from infelix, infelic- 'unhappy', from in- 'not' + felix 'happy'

means.word_mean: 1. inappropriate and unpleasing manner or style (especially manner or style of expression)

auth_sentence.content: By the unhappiness of my Destiny, or the infelicity of the Times, deprived of my Preferments.
auth_sentence.res_content: By the unhappiness of my Destiny, or the infelicity of the Times, deprived of my Preferments.

auth_sentence.content: It is unsurprising that even a statesman with a gift for language, such as Obama, should make the occasional verbal infelicity.
